In India there is an enormous gap between healthcare supply and demand. What do you think are the major steps that can be taken by the government to improve patient care in the country?
first of all I would like to thank BizAcumen for giving me this wonderful opportunity to express my views about healthcare in India. Coming  to the topic , yes there is a lot of gap between healthcare supply and demand in India. Its not a new issue, it has been there since the beginning of healthcare system in India. I feel that the main reason for this problem is negligence of government in healthcare department. Since my childhood I have been seeing  ministers of healthcare department promise the same thing over and over that is "improvisation of required equipment" in hospitals, but till now I have not seen any  such improvisation . Many government hospitals does not even have the required number of staff and equipment.  Top of that private hospitals have become more commercial. Survival of the middle class people and below middle class people has become very difficult . These issues are making patients life a living hell. Its high time the government takes a step to stop these problems.

                                 Government should take initiation to improve healthcare department in India. I feel that government should focus on serving the patients rather than making money. People in remote villages does not even know the a of hospital. Government should start medical  campaigns   in villages to educate them.    They should take the initiative to create the awareness in people about health and healthy habbits . Equipment in hospitals needs to be improved, Even though private hospitals use advanced technology and equipment not many people can afford it. Many patients are  loosing their life due to lack of technology in government hospitals. Government should allot sufficient budget to improve the hospitals .

                              Our ex late CM mr. Rajashekar Reddy had contributed greatly in development of healthcare system in Andra Pradesh. He had introduced "Aarogya shree pathakam" under which few types of diseases will be treated . He had also played major role in improving "Ambulance  services" in Andra Pradesh. Even though the government has introduced some healthcare packages does not mean we have good healthcare system. Government hospitals in India still does not have the proper equipment and technology. Government should allot the required budget to improve healthcare system in India. they should also introduce incentives and other welfare schemes for the people who work in different departments of healthcare to encourage them for the better performance.

                              Development of healthcare system in India is mainly in hands of government. But it does not mean we can't do anything about it. we should  fight for our rights , we should not give up until we get what we want. After all its our money and health that are at stake. So I conclude this topic by saying government should concentrate on reducing the gap between healthcare supply and demand.

                      Once again thank you for giving me this opportunity,
